Reviews.Title: The ONLY Great portable gaming device for under $400
Reviews.Author: MMOLover321564
Reviews.Content: So im a big time gamer and my desktop was assembled by myself and cost me a good chunk of cash, but I needed a portable gaming laptop for the weekends and dont have the cash to shell out for one. This thing is a beast, I dont know how it plays the games it does with the specs that are on it but Ive been playing League of Legends, black ops 2, dota2, starcraft, Final Fantasy 14 mmorpg, world of warcraft all on medium settings with 60 fps, this thing stays cool as can be, and the battery life while gaming straight through is three hours which is falsely advertised but highly expected from anyone who knows a thing about computers. If you are looking for something cheap and will play any current game on the market at medium settings this thing is for you, IT IS the cheapest gaming laptop on the market period! It also does all those boring things like surf web and school project junk ^^ without any stuttering, and can run multiple apps at a time with no lag.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Laptop! This laptop is what ASUS was for the tablet market when they released Nexus 7 with google!!!
Reviews.Author: xplics
Reviews.Content: I am just so pleased with this ASUS laptop. I have now been playing and messing with the new laptop as well as the new to me Windows 8 which overall is not that bad once you get the hang of it. As for the laptop I did my studying before jumping in and buying a decent priced laptop. I decided to go with this laptop due to the price, specs, and having dealt with ASUS with my Nexus 7 which everyone knows was incredible for the price. I was shopping around for a few days before making my mind up on this laptop. I am very pleased with this purchase. I tried a few games already just to see how well the laptop can run the games right out the box, and I am pleased. Far Cry 3 runs great, as do a few other PC games I tried out. Just please keep in mind this laptop is not made for gaming so do not expect some of the newer games coming out to run on maximum settings. The speed of this little bad boy is incredible. The pc has yet to really heat up or make a noise this is after hours of use at a time. The laptop seems really well built. The keyboard is very responsive. Also I was very surprised at how great the screen looks for being only 720p, plus very please at how loud the speakers are for this very overall well put together laptop. The laptop also looks and feels great. I would not try it but I am sure it can take a fall or two. I paid 450 and I honestly if I had hands on prior I would not have mind paying a few hundred more, yes it is really that good. Anyways if your looking for a great laptop for a great price you have one here. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Good product for a great price.
Reviews.Author: Big-E
Reviews.Content: This is a good machine for a great price.  It has a fast processor, a ton of hard drive space, and a huge display.  It also comes with a free 1 year warranty which covers fixing or replacement of the machine even if you drop it or get it wet! The outside of the machine is made of some sort of slip proof material, instead of the shiny plastic that most laptops are made of.  It looks a little weird at first, but I think I kind of like the look of it now.  It's different.  The keyboard is huge and has a number pad, which is a huge step up from my last laptop.  The webcam isn't great, but will suffice for Skype chats.  One of the USB 3.0 ports has a more snug fit than the other for some reason.  I've tried using it more often than the other in order to possibly loosen it up a bit.  The port works fine though.  You just have to use a little more force when connecting or disconnecting a USB device.  Battery life could be better. It will get a little over 5 hours unplugged, but I only use it home so that doesn't really bother me.The only thing that I didn't like about this computer was the Windows 8 operating system.  It's very weird.  It's like Microsoft only wanted to half commit to an app based interface while trying to keep its original identity.  I felt like my computer had multiple personalities.  The interface is not intuitive at all, especially if you're upgrading straight from Windows XP like I did.  There is no start button.  You have to place the mouse arrow on specific parts of the screen in order to accomplish tasks, instead of just clicking on a button or icon.  Thank goodness Asus  included a "tutor" button to teach you how to use these different features.  The app interface portion looks unpolished and the app selection isn't great. However, after much use I have gotten used to Windows 8 and don't mind it so much anymore.  I might even like it a little.  If you don't like Windows 8 you can install Windows 7 on the computer instead.  There are youtube videos that show how to do this.My review isn't based on the Windows 8 operating system.  It's based on the overall quality of the product, taking cost into consideration.  Asus makes a quality product, and it shows.  At $450, this machine is a steal.  It could easily sell for $200-$300 dollars more.  My last laptop cost $100 more than this one, and it was a piece of crap.  I'll deal with the not so great battery life and lack luster camera and take the discount.  I don't think you can find a better laptop for under $500.UPDATE:I still stick with everything that I said above.  However, there is one more minor problem.  The speakers are pretty good quality for a budget laptop, but they're located on the bottom of the computer.  They face down into the table, or your lap if you actually use it that way, and the sound gets kind of muffled.  I don't usually use the speakers since I wirelessly transfer video to my Apple T.V., but I was out of town and the cabin didn't have Wi-Fi.  I tried watching a movie using the speakers and found out about the design flaw.  I just placed the laptop a little farther forward on the table so that the speakers hung slightly over the edge of the table.  The laptop is slightly back heavy so it was secure and I moved it around a bit to make sure there was no threat of it tipping.  It worked fine and the speakers provided ample volume.  Just wanted to make you aware.  It's still a great buy and I still love it.

Reviews.Title: Great, but very weak
Reviews.Author: Chase
Reviews.Content: The laptop itself is a truly amazing product. I was fortunate enough to purchase this laptop whilst it was slightly cheaper, but even now the ASUS K55 is an incredible "bang for your buck." There are absolutely no regrets towards purchasing this laptop. Unfortunately I have come across a small issue regarding the screen, and have no clue how it was conceived. This laptop has been under my care for at least two weeks, all the while furiously curb-stomping any task I have thrown at it, but for some reason the screen has started to fail on me. The top, roughly 1/6th, portion of the screen is completely incapable of anything other than emitting a funky grey or yellow color. I don't know if I had placed the laptop in my bag incorrectly as I was packing during the morning, or if some other nuance managed to take advantage of me. Also, even though I would LOVE to have this replaced, apparently it is not an applicable option.So with that, I will warn all possible customers to be as careful as possible with the screen. Other than that, this laptop is a magnificent product for whatever you may need it for. It is incredibly fast and responsive, and will dominate any task you throw at it. If I were able to get a replacement, and not have to settle for a refund, (or the screen itself didn't give out on me) this laptop would definitely have had received five stars.TL;DRPros:Fast and Responsive A8 quadcore processorVery suitable large hard driveHard drive is also double partitioned (C: & D:)Beautiful 720p graphicsBattery life is decentCons:The screen is either very weak, or mine was defectiveThe mouse pad takes a little getting used toOther:Windows 8 is confusing at first, but I don't see any of the 'major' issues others come up with. Personally, I can dwell in the desktop portion of the OS and go back to the home screen whenever I want to look at stock or other feeds.

Reviews.Title: If you can find a higher quality, more feature laden laptop today, buy it.
Reviews.Author: Muti007
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing machine for the $$. There are others on the market right now for twice the price and more that dont have as much hardware as this thing does, plus its an Asus, an absolute top tier brand.  It looks and feels like you could drop it off of a 30 story building and it would just laugh it off.  Mind you, it isnt really attractive or lightweight and has a pretty big footprint, but its as solid a machine as you can buy.  IF they were charging even $200 more it would be a bargain.

Reviews.Title: Amazing laptop for the money!
Reviews.Author: Erikas Sineokis
Reviews.Content: I must start off saying that this is a second laptop of this spec (and third Asus laptop this year) in the household.These A8-4500 machines perform amazing for what they are used for in the household- laptops that we as university students use for school and personal use. I additionally installed a 8GB RAM stick in place of the 2GB secondary stick and this machine is now one that is hard to overload!As someone who has bought three Asus laptops in the past year, I can also comment on the quality (two of these quad-code AMD's and one Intel i3). I have seen reviews of bad touchpads and bad screens, but all three of our computers functioned perfectly from the moment they were unwrapped from the box.

Reviews.Title: Awesome laptop Awesome Price
Reviews.Author: EVOLUTION
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a laptop in the $400 -$600 range and landed on this laptop. Overall this is a great machine that can be upgraded still so if you still want more machine but don't have the cash this should work great. I love the look of the laptop and it feels very sturdy if not a little on the heavy side. The machine runs cool and is very capable of handling everything except for hardcore gaming. I would not hesitate to recommend this to friends and family.On a side note Windows 8 takes some getting used to but if you use the search function it speeds things up until you find where everything is. Also you can run this is desktop mode which looks like old windows OS's.

Reviews.Title: Best Bang For Your Buck!
Reviews.Author: T-Lee
Reviews.Content: Here we are, the ASUS 15.6-inch laptop, for me, an upgrade from a Toshiba Satellite L655 that was beat up over the course of bringing it to school for over 2 years. Now it's here and I'm blown away with the quality of this laptop, especially for what was given with the price.Description:-Exterior:The exterior design of the laptop is all black with no gloss with a faint line texture to it that would make a zippy sound if you were to run your nail over it. This helps by making it easier to hold. It's not too pretty, but definitely not very ugly. It is around 6 pounds and is very portable. there is a disc drive for CDs on its right, a slot for SD cards underneath on the bottom left, a USB 2.0 output, 2 USB 3.0 outputs, an HDMI output, a VGA, an ethernet port, and outputs for headphone and microphone jacks. Cooling fan vents and speakers are located underneath the laptop.-Interior:A 15.6 inch LED HD screen capable of a little over 720p (it's not a touch screen). It has a keyboard where all the keys are spaced away from each other and depending on your opinion, this may be a nuisance if you prefer your keys closer together for what I guess, faster typing, but to each there own. There is a track pad at the bottom center which at first had a weird texture that goes away after a while. Left and right click buttons are united with the track pad as one thing, and this may get on the nerves at times as it feels so unnatural, but you do get used to it. The power button is on the top left corner of the keyboard and requires little force in pressing it. There is also a fairly decent webcam on top of the screen.Performance:It is best for professional and recreational use. Thanks to its 6 GB ram, it is capable of doing work and running multiple tabs without lag or slowdown. It's fast and start-up is very quick. It comes with Windows 8 and to be honest, I don't understand the hate it gets as it is a very good OS. It takes little effort into figuring it out and I got the gist of it within a few minutes. A tutorial is also provided for those who aren't as adventurous. There are plenty of apps and games for download and if you don't like the interface, there is a retro interface for you to use. Graphics wise, it is very good and although not a gaming laptop, it is capable of playing games. The laptop is silent and keeps cool. Sound quality wise, it is okay, but earbuds, headphones, and speakers are recommended since the quality is affected by the location of the laptop's speakers.Overall:Excellent for what was given and will satisfy my needs in college. I like the speed compared to my old laptop and I love the weight. I love the HDMI output which allows me to use it on my flatscreen TV with an HDMI cord. Windows 8 is an excellent operating system despite all the hate it gets. It is pretty powerful and for the price given, you can't really go any other way.Grade: A+

Reviews.Title: A good share of performance,style and innovation
Reviews.Author: Kerwinn
Reviews.Content: I received this laptop 2 weeks ago and basically decided to write a review to help prospective buyers to make their decision.Performance: This machine performs exceptionally well. Multimedia and even slight gaming would be fine. I tested Sims 3 and call of duty on this laptop and was actually suprised by the frame rates (please note this is not a gaming a machine) . It gets 5/5 for performance because i like the fact that it has 6GB of ram and an Amd quad core processor and a decent graphics processor. The screen is also bright and displays very well 1366x768 is the max resolution which is a little bit higher than 720p high definitionWhat i don`t like: This is especially for techies the bios to me is very limited in the sense that it tries to take away control from the user. I had to modify so many options just to enable it too boot into Usb. Also the audio is sub-par and the operating system feels over loaded which is why i reinstalled.Finally: If you are looking for an affordable laptop then my friends your search stops here. This laptop is generally a good buy and I have not had any problems so far. I hope i`ve been helpful to you and goodbye

Reviews.Title: Incredible Laptop. Really cheap and incredible performance
Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: I love this laptop. I was fortunate enough not to get a defect which is some of the 1-star reviews here.It runs fast and the boot-up is super quick. I have steam installed with Half-Life, Skyrim, and The Sims 3 and they all run smoothly with no issue. So the laptop itself is good for a couple good games. If you're a gamer like me then you won't be disappointed..(NOTE: THESE GAMES ONLY RUN ON MEDIUM SETTINGS OR LOWER. I wouldn't recommend playing them on max settings)As for the negatives....- The speakers aren't really good, I would invest in some headphones or external speakers- The track pad is awful, invest in an external mouse- The webcam is OK. It's good for skype and other minor things but if you're planning on making videos or editing then you'll need to spend some more money on a different laptop. (If that's your purpose of getting a laptop)- It doesn't come with Office, only a trial which I consider to be part of the junk files they start you out with (Virus protection software included)Overall, it's a solid laptop and it's surprising that something so good is so cheap. I highly recommend this laptop.UPDATE!Bought this back in August, still works!Gaming wise:I have Sims 3, Half-Life 2(plus episodes), Skyrim, Sonic Generations, Sonic CD, Black Mesa, Plants vs Zombies, Resident Evil 5, Portal 2, Psychonauts, and Starcraft 2 installed and the Laptop plays them all at medium settings, no problem. I thought it would be helpful to list some games in case some of you were planning on using this for gaming purposes.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price.
Reviews.Author: Jo Warfield
Reviews.Content: I got this computer off of Amazon on sale for $379 and it is worth it if you just need a computer for basic use. I.E. internet, Office documents, and looking at DVDs. I don't know how video games play on it. JPEGs and other picture files colors look a little distorted but nothing too bad considering the price. Funny enough DVDs look just fine. Good computer for school or casual use.

Reviews.Title: Very nice but watch the price
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Kozicki
Reviews.Content: This laptop is a real bargain no matter how you slice it.  I don't know how they can build and sell this for $400 but they do.  Also make sure and register for your extended warranty that even covers damage.One thing to watch for is the price on Amazon seems to be all over the map on this.  I have seen it from $379 - $450.  I got mine for $399 and if you come back to the site a few times it seems that you can get it for that price.  When I 1st added it to my wish list it was $399 but when I put it in my cart it changed to $450 so just keep your eyes open.I would buy this again any day if I needed another laptop.

Reviews.Title: A Cheap Gamer's Computer
Reviews.Author: Tyler
Reviews.Content: This Computer is capable of Playing most last gen and some current gen games at decent frame rates, and is a great work/school computer as well. I would recommend the K55N-DB81 to anyone looking for a cheap gaming computer.

Reviews.Title: Great for Homeschool
Reviews.Author: AngelaG
Reviews.Content: I bought three of these for my home schooled children to use.  The only drawback is they are quite large and cumbersome for kids to carry.  My kids actually like that the screens are big, though, and they mostly use them at home anyway.  The laptop has all the features that they needed to run their homework programs, and they are still able to play minecraft, too. :D

Reviews.Title: Excellent Laptop
Reviews.Author: Clemente21 "Josh"
Reviews.Content: Can't beat it for the price. I searched for a solid laptop for under 500 bucks for a long time before I stumbled upon this and I'm happy I did. Very fast and easy to use. Not a huge fan of windows 8 but I'll adjust and make due.

Reviews.Title: Excellent performer for the money (except the price changed)
Reviews.Author: Hooee
Reviews.Content: This laptop is an excellent performer.  I bought it for a neighbor who needed one for his home use.  After I set it up, I even put the A8 thru its paces with some video games, and it performed well.  The boot up time and "Instant On" feature are very nice.  My only complaint is that now that I want one for myself, Amazon has raised the price by over 10%.  It used to be a great value, but now I would spend the extra $80 and get an A10-based machine.  Overall I still give it 5-stars, because based on the product itself, and the awesome 1-year damage warranty ASUS gives you out of the box, this is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Fauklin
Reviews.Content: Great laptop. Can't beat out for the money. I'm not a fan of windows 8 so I loaded 7 on it. Works great. Fast and smooth.

Reviews.Title: Good Value, it was 399 when I purchased
Reviews.Author: Maine Jeepah "Maine Jeepah"
Reviews.Content: PROS Decent performer for the price.CONS Windows 8 is absolutely a pile of garbage, but that is not Asus's fault.Will be putting windows 7 or another OS on this thing ASAP.Almost bought a toshiba with WIn7 for more money.PROS Layout is good.Weight is ok.Touchpad works fine for me, I am used to much smaller ones so this is luxury,CONS I have owned/worked with numerous laptops over the years. Dell, Gateway, Toshiba, IBM, Lenovo Apple...This has the crappiest sound of all of them.The speakers sound terrible, too "tinny".I know, not the first issue most care about, but this is annoying....at least most of the other brands had halfway decent sound.PROS Cooling seems to work well, I have a dis one dell work laptop that gets very hot in keyboard area. This one does not, decent cooling design.

Reviews.Title: Great little computer
Reviews.Author: Jeri B. Hedges
Reviews.Content: This is a great little computer, but I was disappointed with the speakers, they are very tinny sounding.  I hook up an external speaker on it when I listen to music.

Reviews.Title: I'm kinda surprised.
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about buying this, but I usually trust ASUS and I'm glad I did.Pros:Great performanceGood for gaming (Skyrim is running smoothly on High as do most games I've tried)CheapCons:Trackpads suck no matter what... I suggest buying a cheap wireless mouse.Battery life is usually like 2 and a half hoursBasically, it's good and cheap (a friend got a laptop for like 600$ and this one slays) which isn't something you usually find these days. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a gaming laptop without the high price tag.

Reviews.Title: Solid laptop for the price.
Reviews.Author: Luke Fredette
Reviews.Content: Performs well in medium gaming and computational processing. The only things I don't like about it are because of Windows 8, but you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: Nice Laptop For the Price.
Reviews.Author: MAUL xx
Reviews.Content: I originally ordered an Acer here on Amazon but quickly canceled it when I saw this Asus for about the same price.I've been using this Asus laptop for a couple of days now & so far I'm very happy with my choice.Since I don't have a desktop anymore I wanted the ability to burn discs, play a few games on steam & have a bit more options than my tablet was giving me.Now,let's start with the negatives.1. The LCD screen.While the LCD screen looks nice, you have to get it positioned perfectly. If your line of sight is slightly high or low it washes out.So, viewing angle isn't very good. Minus a half star for that.2. Windows 8.I'm not dinging the laptop for this. I hate windows 8 set up. Right out of the box I went & bought StartIsBack for $3 & it was well spent. Now, I have my old win7 start menu just as it should be. You can keep the charms, apps & touch nonsense.Like I said, I'm not faulting the laptop because of Win 8's foolishness. Out of the box though, win 8 pissed me off enough to buy StartIsBack which helped alot.3. HDD is a bit slow.This could really use a faster HDD. Minus a half star.4. Sound.I'm not dinging this laptop for the sound because it was expected. The sound is well, tiny.You can hear what your doing but I plug in headphones & use my AVR for sound.Now for the good.1. Keyboard.I like the keyboard & number keypad. While they're not real clicky, it is satisfying enough & they register nicely.2. 3D graphics performance.I haven't tried alot of games yet but I have tried Portal 2 on steam & I was impressed with how smoothly it ran on this budget laptop.  Looks like gaming will be a bit better than expected.3. HDMI port & VGA, 2 USB 3.0 ports, 1 USB 2.0 port, SD card slot.I like having these.4. 6GB Ram & 750GB HDD.Not sure how much difference it makes but it's nice to have 6GB of ram. The Acer I purchased only had 4GB of ram & a 500Gb HDD.I'd say this laptop is well worth the $450 I paid for it. For what I want to do, it does the job & then some.If you want a little more 3d graphics beef in this price range this is a good deal. I think it would be hard to find something better.

Reviews.Title: Wow great laptop
Reviews.Author: Bev
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my husband and wish it was mine. It is really nice. Love windows 8. Not hard to use at all. We have a microsoft store in our area and we stopped in and they explained and answered our questions we had. Great store also. So if anyone is out there that has questions and has a store in their area do not hesitate to go there and ask questions.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Crockett
Reviews.Content: Best laptop I've ever owned.  Simple setup, connect 2 wires, insert battery and plug-in the wall.  Silent, about as loud as a Prius.  6 GB ram and a 750 GB hard drive, c'mon.  Can't beat the price either.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop For College
Reviews.Author: College Guy
Reviews.Content: This laptop is everything I have been looking for! I am currently a college student who needed something cheap, powerful, and small enough for transportation. This laptop is very light yet feels very sturdy and well made so I don't worry about it breaking going from class to class. The battery life when being used to search the internet or follow power points is about 4.5 hours, could be better but that's all I need. Its very fast and can complete any homework assignment you need!Now as for the teenage boy in me, let me just say this is also a decent gaming laptop. It can handle most modern games around medium settings at 50 fps. If you play older games you can definitely run on max settings. Which is a great buy since this is only a $400 laptop!Overall I am VERY pleased with Asus and this laptop (plus the one year accidental warranty is a bonus) and I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Reasonably priced gaming laptop
Reviews.Author: C. Ledford "Green Rider Guru"
Reviews.Content: I originally bought the k55n to play World of Warcraft on, which in recent patches has become a more visually demanding MMORPG. The AMD A8 can handle the graphics on high and ultra, though some minor lag can occur on ultra and the graphics are clear and crisp without washing out or appearing too cartoony. I haven't had the chance to test the Bluetooth, but the Ethernet port design is interesting and so far it seems to be a solid laptop. I haven't had issues with the screen like I read a different owner had and the 2-3 second resume is amazing.Pros:- great graphics/audio- great speed- easy to use keyboardCons:- Space between the screen and lid cover makes popping sound on left side/some plastic feels flimsy or not solidly supported from interior- Battery life is decent, but of course for gaming needs to be plugged in- Some issues with using the touch pad mouse only because if you are in a window and swipe your hand just right it will cause you to go to a different window. If you use a Wireless USB/Bluetooth mouse then it is no problem.

Reviews.Title: ASUS laptop quality at a fantastic price!
Reviews.Author: D D
Reviews.Content: This is our first laptop - our son gave us advice.  It works seemlessly.  We actually use a keyboard and larger screen, but we know if we have to we can take it with us.  This was our first step away from the traditional computer and it has given us everything we need.

Reviews.Title: Pretty nice machine
Reviews.Author: Joe Tech
Reviews.Content: I build PC's for fun.  I own 4 laptops, including a Mac, and this one is pretty good.This laptop is really a very good one.  Good speed due to having more RAM than most units in the price range, as well as a solid Processor, and a far larger hard drive than most as well.  It has all the usual ports and places to hook things in.  The SD card reader is a nice touch, but it's in an awkward spot.  The screen is nice and bright, sharp on video as well as stills.I dislike Win8, though it is functional, and I dislike the Mac style track pad, but it is functional, and almost everyone has them now, so...what can you do?You'd have a VERY hard time getting more computer without spending FAR more money.

Reviews.Title: Really great for gaming for it's value!!!
Reviews.Author: Marcus Lui
Reviews.Content: For a laptop at this price your are really getting more bang for your buck.I play dota 2 and FPS games on this and it graphics are great not the best but still great for the price your are paying for.If I had any problems with this laptop it would be the windows 8 just because I don't like windows 8 on non touch screen laptops

Reviews.Title: great specs at an excellent price
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my purchase, it was a big upgrade from my old XPS Dell laptop.  A bit on the heavy side but for a 15.6 in. with everything in it, I am not complaining! Everything runs smoothly, startup and shut down is a breeze, you can start working almost immediately after you enter the desktop.

Reviews.Title: ASUS K55N-DB81 15.6" Laptop, Great features for the price
Reviews.Author: Adam  Merkle
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with this purchase.  Shipped as described with an AMD A8-4500M processor, 6MB RAM, 750 Gb hard drive.  Best value I could find on the web and  would have had to spend at least $100 more for similar specs at any of the local electronic and office supply chains or at a warehouse store.  Keyboard and touchpad work great.  System was easy to setup and it runs smoothly.  Was not sure what to expect from the AMD chip but in two days of use for rather mundane non-gaming tasks, I can see no difference from my Toshiba laptop which runs an I3 3rd generation processor.  Not a fan of Windows 8, but it's not that terrible once you learn where to find things.

Reviews.Title: New laptop for my Granddaughter
Reviews.Author: Margaret Porter
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter told me she needed a new laptop. I researched for a couple of months and decided on the AUS K55N-DB81. I liked the size and it had all the features she woud need. Well its just perfect. She can do all of her school work and play her games onthis laptop. The screen is perfect and its light weight. Im so gla dI shopped Amazon. The price was perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: Ehhhh - not that impressed
Reviews.Author: Daniel Freeman
Reviews.Content: I got this laptop on a Friday and worked with it to see how it worked over the weekend.  In the end I was not pleased with the performance and returned it for another laptop.Pros:good keypadgood price for the specsstays very cool in operationInstant on feature is nice, but doesn't always seem to workCons:wifi was awful - picked up a weak signal from router and dropped often - that changed once I got my new laptop - so an ASUS issuebattery life was not 5.5 as advertised, even on low dim, power saver, no wifi - got maybe 3.5 hours just setting things up on the new PC like this - not too pleaseNot sure if this was Windows 8 or the PC, but it NEVER remembered any setting changes I made - it always went back to defaultOverall, it was not a bad computer, but when Im buying a brand new laptop, I want things to work perfectly out of the box, not have these little issues, that will only get worse.  I spent $100 more on my next one and was much much more pleased.Its good for the price, but definitely has its weaknesses.  Im not sure if I got a dud or what, but it might be worth a gamble.

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: Trisha
Reviews.Content: If you need a computer that will 1) operate rather quickly 2) not overheat 3) is fairly user friendly and most importantly 4) be a good value! This computer is able to handle basic needs...editing photos, using Microsoft Office occasionally, internet searches/purchases, and storing my massive amount of accumulated data. It serves its purpose-- I am not one that cares about the latest and greatest computers out there...my goal is functionality!  If this sounds like you...purchase it!

Reviews.Title: love it sooo much
Reviews.Author: Discover "Delaney Rae"
Reviews.Content: I love this laptop so much, I am on it right now and I haven't had any problems yet. I think windows 8 is not that hard compared to what all the other comments say! I play minecraft and browse the web and they are both super fast

Reviews.Title: Love it, love it, love it.
Reviews.Author: T. Anderson
Reviews.Content: Love it, love it, love it.  Lots of machine for the money, and to my surprise, Windows 8 doesn't suck. (just install Start 8 for Win 7's familiar start menu)  I'm now an Asus fanboy!

Reviews.Title: Pretty Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: jacob
Reviews.Content: I bought the laptop about a month ago and here's what I think of it so far.It has an extremely nice feel to it.The texture on the top is very pleasing.It's made out of plastic, however, the construction is very good.It's very fast compared to my desktop.Asus is definitely a great brand.Windows 8 is just fine once you get used to it. Although I would recommend updating to Windows 8.1 once you get the computer.My one and only complaint. The track-pad is terrible and takes a bit of time to get used to. (Mine get's stuck clicking sometimes) So make sure you have an actual mouse if you want to do anything that uses the mouse on this.I mostly use the laptop for gaming. (It runs Mirrors Edge while recording with Fraps at 27-30 FPS)I would definitely recommend getting this laptop. It is an absolutely great buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop
Reviews.Author: Krystina Butler
Reviews.Content: This laptop is great.  It is super fast and resumes quickly after resumed from sleep mode.  The graphics are really fantastic.  I was actually shocked at how great the graphics were when I first bought it and it plays video games really well, especially high powered games like Skyrim.  Windows 8 sucks, to be honest but you get used to it.  And if it is really that bad, there are ways to install Windows 7 instead.  But there will be a lot of apps and material that will need to be uninstalled regardless.Some of the main cons that I have that prevented me from giving 5 stars for this laptop is that the speakers are on the bottom of the laptop.  So if it is sitting on bed or any surface that is not hard like a table the sound is muffled.  Also, the mouse pad has smart gesture which is awesome but it occasionally randomly turns off for no reason, but restarting it resolves it so it isn't that bad. It's mostly just little annoying things.  Overall this is a great laptop, though.  I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great cheap laptop!
Reviews.Author: Darin Fields
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for my birthday and I have no regrets so far. This laptop while quite heavy is a beast. I play Minecraft,League of Legends,Dragon nest and plenty other games on medium settings on 60 fps. Its also good for school and work purposes. And if you just want to chill and watch some YouTube you will be happy with the beautiful 720p. A couple of snall flaws with this laptop is the track pad. I use  wired mouse so it doesn't matter much to me. The laptop it self is also very heavy.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for a cheap price
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: This laptop is great.  It runs smooth and the performance is awesome. It surprised me how well it runs for games such as League of Legends at 60 fps at this price. I guess the only bad thing is Windows 8 but it isn't much of a problem, you can get used to it.

Reviews.Title: very decent and well made laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: Pierre Decembre
Reviews.Content: Very decent laptop for everyday use.  Very well made, although I would've preferred to have had 1 or 2 more USB ports, but overall for the price it's great.  I formatted everything and re-install windows 8.1 it works like a charm except that I think I've lost of of Asus's hard drive speed configuration.  Overall I'm happy with this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop!
Reviews.Author: Sean S.
Reviews.Content: This computer is a great value for all that it includes.  As a gamer, it has worked great with any game I've played on it: D3, Modern Warefare 3, COD.Best laptop I have been able to find for the price point, bar none!

Reviews.Title: Terrific Buy
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: I purchased this unit based on price and ratings.  Thank you Amazon raters.  I am not a gamer, I do standard laptop usage- email, stocks,  streaming, office products, etc.  I also need to have a computer that still will run programs, otherwise I would have purchased the Samsung Chrome device.  The world has not yet caught up with "the cloud".Having said that, this is a GREAT device.  Very fast, very quiet, fast bootup (for Microsoft).  If you need a non-gaming unit, this is the one to choose.  I use the HDMI output to drive a 32" TV.  Works great!  It also buffers well for streaming.Like almost everyone, I do not like Windows 8.1.  However, do not let that effect your decision.  It is either Windows 8 or Chrome

Reviews.Title: Value for money
Reviews.Author: Ilya Edelstein
Reviews.Content: The laptop is solid piece of equipmentPacks a lot of punch for the buck.Not very stylish but very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop, good pride
Reviews.Author: tefrank
Reviews.Content: I needed a replacement for a 7-year-old laptop, and this seemed to be a decent replacement on paper. It does just what I need it to do. It does like to restart itself every couple days, which is annoying and I haven't figured out how to make it stop that. The mouse is pretty sensitive as well, and it'll jump to the start menu without my wanting it to, but I am pretty sure that's a Windows 8 glitch, not anything to do with the actual computer.

Reviews.Title: I really like it
Reviews.Author: Dar
Reviews.Content: I think this laptop works very well, i'm personally not a fan of Windows 8 but other than that everything seems to be working well.  I was skeptical when i saw that it was an AMD because  i've always have been told to get an i5 or i7 but for this price, and the fact that its just for like High school work i think i would recommend it.  When i go off to college i will be getting a new laptop that is very nice, but this one works very well until then and for home use for the rest of my family.  It feels high quality with all the parts.  It doesn't feel too plastic or anything.  I dislike the weight because i'm a small person so carrying it in my back back along with books and binders can be annoying but by itself it is great.

Reviews.Title: Really great laptop for it's power and price.
Reviews.Author: Jose
Reviews.Content: I have been searching for a laptop that could handle most games I play such as team fortress 2, league of legends, and Magic 2014. I am happy to say that this laptop definitely can run them and very well too :) Windows 8 on this isn't so bad either with this laptop, I bought start 8 so I could tolerate windows 8 not having a start button. Battery power is really great too, lasts me 3 hours with a full charge. Only Issues I have had with this laptop is that when you first get it, it updates randomly when shutting down the PC leaving you to wait for quite some time until the thing stops updating which can be pretty annoying if you are in a hurry to get somewhere. It was only a few times it updated on it's own but it's fine now. Also, took me a while to adjust to the contrast and brightness of the screen but you get used to it.

Reviews.Title: great laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: Varune
Reviews.Content: definitely a powerful budget laptop.. great specs and good performance. works smoothly with windows 8. with 6 gb ram and a 750 gb hd, there really isnt anything this laptop cant do. it even runs some graphic demanding games like crysis pretty well

Reviews.Title: ASUS K55N-DB81 15.6-Inch Laptop (Black)
Reviews.Author: Bernie
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice laptop.  Windows 8 is it's great drawback.  It gets in the way of everything you want this laptop for.  I knew this going into the purchase, so I am not taking stars off for the Horrific!!!!!!! Windows 8 OS.  Microsoft, I hope you are listening!The display with great color and resolution and LED backlight, the keyboard, the battery life, and the general feel of the laptop are wonderful.  It is light for its size.  The ASUS video player is wonderful as well.  I can't praise ASUS enough for creating this very nice laptop at this very reasonable price point.The OS just takes all the joy away from having such a nice laptop.  I will "upgrade" to Windows 7 as soon as I find out that the laptop will remain operational after this one improvement.  I will also replace the hard drive with an SSD.  Either Windows 8, or the hard drive make this machine sluggish.  I haven't figured out which is the culprit.  It is a four core, 2GHz system.  It should not be sluggish!  I wish that all new computers came with Windows 7 preloaded with a pay for option to "Upgrade" to the Windows 8 experience.If there is a Con to this laptop, ignoring the OS (have you figured out yet that I HATE Windows 8 yet?), it is the power connector at the laptop.  It is very hard to plug in and to remove.  But that is minor.Buy it, it is well worth it, especially if you are a Windows 8 fan.  (I am not!)Bernie

Reviews.Title: Pretty Decent Overall
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Hawks
Reviews.Content: I like the laptop, it really only has one flaw - the touchpad and touch options from Windows are really annoying.  I'll be playing a game or using a program, accidentally touch the side of the touchpad, and it will switch to the Start screen and boot me from the program.  Not certain where the hitbox is on that, or I'd avoid it.  This is more of a nit-picky thing, however, because when I use a mouse the whole thing is negated.  It's only frustrating during those times when I can't use the mouse.Aside from that, the laptop is great.  Good performance, especially for the price; the sound and video are good; it's been quick to boot and I've had no system trouble with it.  Even Windows 8 are by and large not that bad, aside from the aforementioned touchpad issues.  I'd recommend to anyone :)

Reviews.Title: Cheapest Gaming
Reviews.Author: Hasan Ozkan
Reviews.Content: I bought this to have a pc at home. I do not carry it around yet. It has really good specifications, it plays 'kerbal space program' perfectly. Since it is a game that may require a good rig, I think this computer is really good. I love ASUS and they have made really good job with this one.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Elaine Walker
Reviews.Content: It does not heat up like previous laptops.  It's not that heavy. I would definitely recommend it for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth R. Holloway
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my grandson, a senior in high school.  He researched and found that this had every thing he needed and for a great price!  He is very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Nice little laptop for an awesome price
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: I built a desktop a few years ago using an Asus motherboard so when I was looking for a laptop figured I'd try one of theirs. The laptop is working great and got it at a really great price. Took me a little while to get used to Windows 8 but it's running perfectly

Reviews.Title: Great for gaming
Reviews.Author: Darel
Reviews.Content: I'm an avid gamer and this laptop definitely runs my games well. I cannot run most games on ultra graphics but this laptop works great on high graphics. Great price, too!

Reviews.Title: Great 1st laptop
Reviews.Author: enewman17
Reviews.Content: I don't think that much needs to be said other then this is a great computer. Obviously if your looking for a gaming laptop this is not it. But for the average user this is more then enough machine to do whatever you want to do. Aside form Windows 8... which honestly isn't that bad once you install something like Classic Shell to get back to a Win7/8 UI. Then once you get past a few things they moved around It's not that much different form Win7. I'm starting to like the mash up of desktop programs and the more mobile interface with apps, it just takes a little getting use to. Spending a bit more and getting a laptop with a touch screen would enhance the Win8 experience but you can't go wrong with this laptop at all. For the price, the quality, speed and function is second to none. My only complaint is why does it have a vga output???? Asus I would opt for a DVI output, who has a monitor that uses vga. The Screen quality is good a little washed out but good for a laptop. Viewing angles are good as well, no complaints. The keyboard... figuring I was not going to like typing on it I actually prefer it now vs. my desktop. The processor has handled every task I've thrown at it with ease. I don't game, but video and streaming has all been flawless. If your thinking about buying this laptop stop thinking about it and go ahead and buy it I don't regret my purchase at all. I simply don't have anything bad to say. Thanks Asus, this makes like my thousandth product form you.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: AB
Reviews.Content: Fantastic laptop that features Windows 8, which I know a lot of people don't care for but once you get the hang of it you'll really start to appreciate it (and if you STILL don't like it, just download Start8. Problem solved). Anyway, has everything I wanted in a laptop and I wanted one that would enable me to download certain programs to finish my schoolwork, yet also be compatible enough for current games. This accomplishes both in a great way. Of course there are better gaming laptops available out there, but this one certainly is no slouch. I've downloaded Tomb Raider(2013), Natural Selection 2, Dota 2, AVA, Ragnarok 2 among other games and they all run fine. Shows great quality for movies (not Blu Ray compatible but since I have a PS3 I didn't need one for this laptop). Probably the only (somewhat) major issue I've had is that it has a tendency to overheat occasionally and I might need to buy a cooling fan/pad. Other than that, virtually no issues and it's more than worth the price. An overall high quality laptop at a bargain price, and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Computer
Reviews.Author: Adrienne
Reviews.Content: It was awesome!  My son is really happy with it.  He wanted some used computer but then we saw this one that met our budget and couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: It is a good laptop with specifications that match my need.
Reviews.Author: Abhimanyu
Reviews.Content: It has good looks. The keyboard was good. The specifications matched my requirements. Best of all, it was just for 400$.

Reviews.Title: A good laptop for everyday general use.
Reviews.Author: Ron Scagliotti
Reviews.Content: Computer works fine. A good buy for the money. Its all I need for everyday projects.Windows 8 was a real pain to get used to.It took a lot of trial and error,but all is well now.

Reviews.Title: VERY PLEASED!!
Reviews.Author: gijones
Reviews.Content: BOUGHT THIS FOR MY SON JUST LEAVING FOR COLLEGE.  SO FAR HE LOVES IT.  FAST IN DOWNLOADING APPS AND HE USES IT FOR GAMING AND IT IS MUCH FASTER THAN THE PC HE HAD.

Reviews.Title: great laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: Grandmaster Vincent Rodricks
Reviews.Content: meets all my expectations, would recomend it to all my friends. it is the ideal gift for my son who is starting colleage this year

Reviews.Title: good computer
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I like the computer a lot but had to return it because the battery would not last for as long as advertised.  I loved their 'instant on'  feature but I think that used the battery up.  since we had to return it anyway we upgraded to the touch screen model.  windows 8 works much better with a touch screen.

Reviews.Title: Excellent laptop, great hardware for the price.
Reviews.Author: Cody Ballweg
Reviews.Content: I am extremely satisfied with my Asus K55N-DB81. If you're looking for a laptop capable of school/business work with some gaming, then this laptop is the one to go with. It's very speedy on start up and when running programs like Office, web browsing, email or the various Windows 8 apps. The AMD Radeon 7640 and A8-4500M quad-core APU do a decent job of gaming, capable of low to medium settings on more recent titles like Sleeping Dogs or Final Fantasy 14 Online: A Realm Reborn, where I would usually average about 20 to 35 fps. With another such game like Warframe being around 45 to 60 fps on medium settings. Coupled with 6gb of DDR3 RAM in 2gb and 4gb sticks, and the laptop handles itself pretty well. I personally plan on upgrading to 8gb of RAM, but that's more for personal preference than any fault of the hardware.A few gripes I have are that the screen isn't up to par, as it exhibits some noticeable screen tearing during video playback and some games. Another is that Windows 8 is not really that great at first, but it's really more based on my unfamiliarity with the system rather than the laptop itself.Overall, this laptop is a great purchase for the money and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: NICE
Reviews.Author: MG
Reviews.Content: Fast delivery. Great laptop for my brother. He loves ASUS  laptop for gaming too. It was very useful item for him. Would definitely recommend it. Brand new, sealed. It is very light too. It's easy to carry-on. The color was perfect and no complaints at all. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Best I have seen in most respects.
Reviews.Author: mystic712000
Reviews.Content: Running my own IT company I have seen a lot of different computers over the years. This little laptop is quite impressive. It is not the perfect end all of laptops but it certainly comes close in most respects. It is that its a bit delicate feeling, however how little I paid for it I cant complain. I would like to see Asus make a model with the same components but a tank of a case and then I could sell these to a ton of people. Look at the price its going for, ,I bought mine for like 390 bucks, their going for just shy of 600 used, and new their going for 800 in some places. Frankly its worth it, dollar for dollar this laptop outdoes its competition, and im talking intel I7 laptops. I am also talking real life experience not them stupid benchmarks which dont show you the whole picture. I tried to get ahold of one of these from Asus and their still making them but their not listed on their web site. I also noticed that their not selling AMD anymore at all on their web site. I am concerned that their being strong armed into it. Anyway, IF you can get one of these laptops for gaming, a nice theater experience, or fast business work, its all in it. I have not found a weakness in it other than the case being a bit weak. OH and for you windows 8 haters, I cant blame you :-) so I installed back in the start menu using a program called classic shell, and just run from the normal desktop, sooo nice and the things free too. just google classic shell.

Reviews.Title: Cheap but good replacement.
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I to replace my Toshiba that my toddler submerged in water.  This is a decent cheap replacement.  Didn't like the Windows 8 that came with it so downgraded to 7 and it works just fine.

Reviews.Title: I've come back from the Mac side.
Reviews.Author: K.A.K
Reviews.Content: This is my first laptop I've purchased that hasn't been a mac. I didn't do super extensive research before purchasing. This one was in the my price range and had decent reviews.I've been using this computer for almost a year now and I am pleased with my purchase. It's a reliable laptop for someone who is looking for word processing and internet browsing. Not for gamers or media production. The track pad is weirdly sensitive-- rectified by a mouse (my preference, anyway) and the speakers are on the bottom of the laptop. That makes no sense to me, but, there you have it.

Reviews.Title: Cassandra's Review
Reviews.Author: Cassandra Delacruz
Reviews.Content: Great product. Look is amazing. Keyboard is smooth. Easy and fast. The only problem really is that the battery life is no where near 5 hours. Maybe lasts about 1 hour at most. But plugging into an outlet is not such a big deal for me.

Reviews.Title: A great computer for the price
Reviews.Author: Rachel Box
Reviews.Content: Well packaged. This computer meets the needs we were looking for as far as speed and graphics. Using this for game design.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Toshia
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is an excellent laptop. Always cool to touch. Excellent speed and load times. Love the fact that the keyboard is spill resistant! I would buy this again in a heartbeat. small, light weight, great graphics. No complaints here. I have worked with computers since the early 90s, played on computers since the early 80s. If you are not a gamer or graphic designer.... this laptop is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Jairus Strunk
Reviews.Content: Works just as i expected. In fact it works better than i expected. The specs are great for such a low price. I've been testing it out with a bunch of different games and the video card handles them wonderfully, providing great visuals with very little to no stuttering. I give this computer 5 stars. because its perfect for the price

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase!
Reviews.Author: Zack Nuñez
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this laptop. I have been using it for school and entertainment. It works great for all my needs.

Reviews.Title: Husband LOVES this notebook!
Reviews.Author: burbankd
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for my husband and he loves it. He's taking time learning Windows 8 but enjoys the journey ;)

Reviews.Title: Good value for money laptop, good for gaming, could not get it to dual-boot Ubuntu still
Reviews.Author: Rohit Khapare
Reviews.Content: The only thing I find lacking in this laptop is there is no straight-forward way to get it to dual-boot Ubuntu or any Linux distro with the stock Windows 8. If you think you might want to be able to do that in the future, this laptop is not for you. Otherwise it's a really great buy. Cheap, light-weight, powerful, good battery-life, comfortable keyboard layout, no shortage of USB ports. Hasn't got any fancy looks or anything but you get the best of what you pay for ...

Reviews.Title: It's fine
Reviews.Author: Dorothy W. Knnapp
Reviews.Content: It's fine and seems to be working ok.  I am only beginning to use it and this process is ridiculous

Reviews.Title: Love and Hate Relationship
Reviews.Author: R. Piltzer "Rocklen"
Reviews.Content: Like the computer itself...fast processor and well built.  I HATE Windows 8 but am not ready to shell out the high cost for Windows 7 and would have to pay a tech to switch it out with 8.  So a nine for the computer...a 1 for Windows 8...Most unfortunately the software helps to ruin the enjoyment of using this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great little laptop but windows 8.
Reviews.Author: Barry F. Burch "barry"
Reviews.Content: The quality of the laptop is impressive. The windows 8 system is something I thought I would grow to like. I was wrong. The more I use windows 8 the more I hate it. Tried going to a windows blog for help from windows experts. Rather than help, they basically tell you that you are an idiot for not liking their product.

Reviews.Title: GARBAGE
Reviews.Author: nick202
Reviews.Content: This is the worst laptop ive ever owned. It Quit working after a few months. Windows 8 is a joke

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: K. Livingston
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer back in November, and so far everything seems to be well. The laptop I owned before this one was a Compaq Presario CQ56 with only 2GB of ram and 200GB harddrive (which was really great for the money I spent on it, but...) but it was starting to fail me after a couple of years and there wasn't really much I could do with its limited specs. So I figured it was time to upgrade. And this is what I chose.I've read reviews about bad screens, and bad touch pads, and so far I haven't experienced anything alarming other than the fact that the "charms swipe" thing won't stay disabled for longer than a day or two so it's annoying as heck, but nothing I can't make do with. It runs really well and the fan barely makes noise at all.My only REAL complaint, and something that's been worrying me, is I'll hear the harddrive click incessantly on a regular basis. It'll stop if I restart it or eventually go away on its own, but it's still something that kind of unnerves me a little and I really hope it's nothing.

Reviews.Title: Nieve at first but happy i bought it!
Reviews.Author: Teryl Mullan
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about buying this laptop with the price and what it said it had in it but now that i have been using it for months with no issues i am glad i bought it, the hardware is exactly what it said, good for work and playing some intensive games, however this is not a gaming laptop. The quick charge is a nice feature and when i bought it it came with a one year drop and spill warranty that made me feel safe about this purchase. Asus makes great products in my experience and i currently own 4 Asus products. i would definitely recommend this laptop to someone who is looking for a little processing power (or speed) on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop!
Reviews.Author: S. Langley "Kursah"
Reviews.Content: I needed a laptop for school, I picked this up in late August. I wanted a decent sub $400 laptop, which it was at the time. I did a lot of research that led me back to this as a good choice. I've used it A LOT. The battery isn't the greatest but will last 4-5 hours if you use it lightly, it also charges very quickly too.The performance is better than expected, very solid. I have a few games on here, Skyrim, SupCom2, Evochron Mercenary, Planetary Annihilation, Diablo 2 and 3, Borderlands 2, etc. All games play better than expected! I have considered replacing the screen with a matte finish, but the vibrant and easy to read factor with this gloss screen is really good!This laptop has been put through it's paces and has held up very well! I've used it for school, work, home, kids, and it's great! Windows 8 isn't all that bad either. It's snappy and once you add Classic Start or a similar start menu, it's like a snappier WIndows 7. The sound output isn't bad, just set a flat EQ or turn EQ off and use Foobar's EQ for music. I use various ear buds and full size heapdhones with good success.Having the DVD drive has been useful one time, but it was oh so necessary at that time, so glad this had it!I am considering putting Ubuntu on this in the future after the warranty expires and school's over. I have a feeling this laptop will be kicking around and performing quite well still at that point!I also got a Logitech M325 mouse to use and it works great. Though the touchpad works very well and I hate touch pads! The keyboard is decent too. I really can't fault the whole package, it's a solid value with solid specs. Well worth a look and serious consideration!

Reviews.Title: Weird keyboard!
Reviews.Author: Marquil Liu
Reviews.Content: The panel behind the keyboard rattles when I write on the left side of it as if it hadn't been properly adjusted, also the mouse pad has a slight gap on the right side as if the pad had been installed too much to the left. Good laptop but it has trouble updating windows...

Reviews.Title: Not the best
Reviews.Author: Jessica Holy
Reviews.Content: While the specs were good there are some issues. The keyboard and touch pad is placed awkwardly. I have not been able to reformat it - it won't take Windows 7 and it won't update its Windows 8 OS. The price was good but it's more of a headache than a useful device.

Reviews.Title: computer review
Reviews.Author: duncan
Reviews.Content: love the computer; love the display and graphics...DON"T love the operating system, I should have gone with a touch screen; that is my only regret.

Reviews.Title: Not even 1 week of use...don't spend your money here.
Reviews.Author: Jamboram
Reviews.Content: Bought this early for a Christmas present as I like to get shopping out of the way before the rush. Christmas came and the gift was presented. A few days later (less than a week) it crashed. We tried to reboot it but it kept looping then we contacted 3 professionals to figure what went wrong and no one can fix it. We decided to return it but couldn't to Amazon since the 30 day warranty had already passed (prob should have bought the extra warranty, thought I didn't need it though cause I bought an HP less than 6 months before without the warranty and it was fine). We tried contacting Asus directly as their warranty was still valid but we keep getting the run around, nothing they recommend works. The Asus tech thinks we may have been sold a refurbished laptop. VERY, VERY DISAPPOINTED! Will not buy from this seller again..........UPDATE: A couple days after submitting this review, I contacted Amazon to see if they could help as I was not getting any where with Asus. Within a few minutes I got confirmation of a refund and they apologized for my distress. Within couple days the refund was sent much to my surprise. Well done, Amazon! By that time though, Asus also confirmed that they will replace the item. So now I'm waiting again.

Reviews.Title: Great Portable, and Cheap Gaming laptop
Reviews.Author: levi roberts
Reviews.Content: Ok this is going to be a long review just bear me. I got this laptop for some light to moderate gaming, on low and med settings with decent battery life. Well, I got much more than that. I am able with this laptop to play older titles like modern warfare 3 on highest settings above 60fps, and more high end games such as far cry 3 on medium. The battery life on this thing is amazing with 2-2 1/2 hrs while gaming and 5 hrs while browsing the Internet, that's very good for a laptop at this low of a price. Also you can upgrade the APU (CPU + GPU) on this laptop fairly easily to an a10. I do recommend you get a ssd for this laptop, as the hdd is painfully slow. I recommend the mushkin deluxe. Also what I love about this laptop is the air intake is indented, so you can put it on your lap without blocking the vent witch is a huge plus for me. I also love the texture of the laptop with the small bumps on it, much better than glossy. Way to go Asus! I also feel like i should mention its durability. I had it in a back pack and it fell out onto marble floor. It survived a 5+ ft fall without a scratch.Now onto the bad.With a laptop at this price I knew I would come across some problems along the way. The first problem I came across is the touchpad, u can't click and move the mouse at the same time very well, and you can't right and left click at the same time witch is a problem If you like touchpads for gaming. Also a very annoying feature from Asus is the smart gestures, because you would do one of the gestures mid game and it would minimize the game. A quick uninstall fixed the problem. The monitor on it also has ok viewing angles, and is glossy witch is a plus or minus depending on your opinion. Only has 1 HDD slot, kinda unfortunate if you're planning on going with a SSD and want to keep your old hard driveConclusion:I highly recommend this laptop to anybody, for everything other than gaming on the newest games on high settings. I would definitely get a SSD as it will unlock the full potential of this laptop. I would get 8gb of ram if your gaming, so you can do dual channeled ram. Windows 8 is bearable for me if you upgrade to windows 8.1 in the marketplace, then get start 8. It is a pain to install Linux with the uefi and secure boot, so if u plan on doing Linux just do a virtual machine. This is a amazing alternative to getting a Xbox one or ps4 because you can take it everywhere, and it is even cheaper than a console. The price has risen a bit from when I got it but it is still definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: Asus in Aces
Reviews.Author: Patrick M.
Reviews.Content: This laptop is great.My son raised the cash to make this buy and I've been completely satisfied with its performance.The price was right for the features and the performance!The case feels durable and all moving parts feel solid.I've been very satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great for heavy architecture programs
Reviews.Author: Kevin Olson
Reviews.Content: Use this laptop for all my architecture work, which includes CAD programs, adobe suites, Rhino 3D, etcMy brother plays video games on it, like Minecraft, with no problems.Phenomenal laptop. Runs efficient (like Apple products), stays super cool on any surface (like all asus products), USB 3.0 is super fast, and has withstood my daily backpacking abuse and one 3 ft drop, which still scares me to think about.Have had it for 1 year now with no complaints or problems.Would recommend this one to almost anyone, whether light or heavy work.

Reviews.Title: My Brother Loves It!
Reviews.Author: Anya
Reviews.Content: My Younger brother is now in college and I surprised him with this laptop before he left for school and he was blown away! The resolution doesn't go as high as mine unfortunately (1920x1080), but the price was way too good to pass up and it's still quite gorgeous. the matte screen is so great, and the construction to the laptop throughout is very classy and quite nice. I purchased this in August 2013 and Now in January 2014 he has encountered no problems.  He regularly runs Borderlands 2 with no complaints, and for a person as picky as he is that's saying quite a lot!

Reviews.Title: does not connect to wireless connections after 2 feet away from router
Reviews.Author: DavidJon
Reviews.Content: i had purchased this asus thinking i was getting a good deal but it turns out the wireless card is weak or something ive sent it in 3 times, One time they sent it back with the wrong hard drive i strictly wrote what was wrong with it in the letter i sent in the box with the asus  laptop they still sent it back stating it was fixed but was not fixed at all,theres even a missing screw they lost for the wireless card i know this because i had to buy a new wireless card an install it myself so it works now ,Their service is not good very poor.thanks alot for the let down ASUS.

Reviews.Title: 15,6 inch Laptop (black)
Reviews.Author: Mavis Lewis
Reviews.Content: Yea, I would. It was for my granddaughter Ava Lehrman who lives in America with her parents.  I would like to buy a tablet next month  for my daughter and will contact you again.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Laptop for the Price
Reviews.Author: Neil Thackar
Reviews.Content: I think you can't find a better laptop, for $450.  I've had it for +6 months, and it hasn't failed me a single time.  It runs everything I give it without any problems.  I don't really see why there are people saying that the keyboard is flimsy, it doesn't feel that way to me.The only reservations I have, which probably won't matter to most people, is the that "0" key is way to small on the number pad, and I can never press it reliably.  Also, the speakers are horrible.  If you buy this, plan on using external speakers/headphones.

Reviews.Title: Good Computer
Reviews.Author: Peter McNally
Reviews.Content: Son uses this for his engineering courses.  He has had no issues with it to date.  The only thing we do not like is it has windows 8.  Good product

Reviews.Title: BEst for price
Reviews.Author: Trasse "Trassetra"
Reviews.Content: My 15 yr old son loves this christmas gift, He plays minecraft and terraria on it and he says there is absolutley no lag whatsoever and he loves it.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: Toni Phillips
Reviews.Content: I'm a full time college student & spent a lot of time trying to figure out which laptop to buy. I'm an Apple user, but wanted something less expensive & finally decided on this one. Most complaints I have read were only on the new windows operating system, not the computer itself. I bypass Windows 8 as I bought Startdoc for $5 which allows my computer to run in the "older" format of Windows which I like better. My only complaint is the trackpad, as its sensitive. This can be annoying @ times so when I'm doing a paper I typically use my wireless mouse. I bought my laptop in August & use it daily and haven't had any problems with it. I am extremely happy with my purchase and decision to buy this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Glad I purchased this laptop
Reviews.Author: Rob Worth
Reviews.Content: My son suggested I purchase the ASUS since they have always been known to have quality product.  I got this one to replace an aging Dell that took a surge.The ASUS came with Windows 8.0 on it.  Although I understand operating systems, Win 8 is in a breed all by itself.  I can see why many people don't like it when they expect an interface similar to either their smart phones or prior Window versions.  What most people don't know is that there is a link on the ASUS Start Screen which will take you to the standard desktop interface.  Most new computers make you look for that link.  ASUS doesn't.  That's a really good thing because it says ASUS is in tune with what the using community really wants.Only complaint I have is that the reviews I read said it came with Microsoft Office.  Yes, it was on the computer only it wasn't free.  Microsoft wanted me to give them a bunch of money.  I didn't because I already had a license for an earlier version which I installed and which works quite well.  What ASUS did was place a 10-Day Evaluation product on the computer.  That's not the same as providing live product as part of the price.It also comes with a bunch of utilities including virus checkers and firewalls.  Very nice for the uninformed and provides some protection which users generally wouldn't know how to select the right software.  Another PLUS for ASUS.For the price, I wish there were more USB ports.  And, it's to bad there is one port on the right side of the case.  anything plugged into that port gets in the way of an external mouse, which I use.  I prefer a mouse over the finger pad.  However, if you have one of those Logitech Smart mice, you could plug the wireless USB thingy into the port on the right.  It's be small enough not to interfere with the mouse movements.The screen is nice and bright.  You do have the option of toning it down with the function key and one of the functions embedded with the top row function keys.  Or you can go into the Control Panel and adjust the brightness there.

Reviews.Title: Great computer!
Reviews.Author: Ashley Wood
Reviews.Content: This computer is perfect for what I need. I am an online student and it has everything I could need for school. Plenty of memory, great battery life, and I can't complain about the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: Perfectly Capable General Purpose Laptop
Reviews.Author: Norsican
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace my old  Inspiron 9300 as the general family laptop so this is quite the jump from what I had.Those with PROs in their review are correct. It certainly plays Civ 5, Diablo III at respectable quality but make no mistake, This is not a "gaming laptop." Full 10-key was a plus. Can't say how much I missed that.Windows 8 (and 8.1): We don't have issue with either. Take the 5 minutes to figure it out. There is a desktop.Only CON I can think of is the screen. There's something about it that I don't care for. Seems washed out and I haven't found where I am allowed to change the  Contrast/Gamma/etc so there's that. Not really a CON but it is a pain at times.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: N. Barker
Reviews.Content: So I got this laptop for my mom. I am pretty happy with it for what it is. She enjoys it, but getting used to Windows 8 was not her favorite (I ended up installing a start button, etc). She uses it daily and says it is great for her needs.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop but has a few problems
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: The laptop is fast and light weight, but I constantly disconnect from wifi, and my router is 20 feet away from me. The other problem is, randomly the laptop will freeze and then the screen turns blue and it said a error has occurred, then the laptop restarts. This gets really annoying when I am doing school work

Reviews.Title: okay
Reviews.Author: Jordan Cuevas
Reviews.Content: this Computer I bought for a Chinese friend and was happy, just wish it was not so slow! nothing loaded and it was slow! :( but it is okay for net.

Reviews.Title: Pretty  impressed
Reviews.Author: Helberth Torres
Reviews.Content: Cons:  - The touchpad  - Windows 8  -Hard driveEverything else is  very impressing. I use it mostly for playing and so far so good, playing League of Legends on High, GTA4 on medium and even COD: Ghosts on medium, it's great for the price.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional.
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: For the price this is honestly an amazing laptop. Windows 8 takes some getting used to, but in the long run it's better then 7.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy an ASUS laptop
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: The hinge mechanism is faulty workmanship. I bought the laptop in August 2013. The hinge broke and because it is molded to the LCD, ASUS is expecting me to pay $165 as well as shipping ($30.00) for the repair. ASUS will not stand by its warranty even though the hinge initially broke after my owning it only 2 weeks. This was my second ASUS laptop within 2 months. ASUS stood by that warranty but not this one. I have never written a negative review in my life but my frustration is extremely high.

Reviews.Title: Great PC for the money
Reviews.Author: YankeeFan
Reviews.Content: Does all that I want,email, web surfing, and movies on YouTube. Not as complicated as I thought. It was easy to get the PC started and using.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop.
Reviews.Author: JC
Reviews.Content: Very happy with it. Exactly what we were looking for. Game platform works just fine. Nice case and design. I would recommend this to friends.

Reviews.Title: Great Computer
Reviews.Author: rleblanc "Randy"
Reviews.Content: Great Computer. Bought it for my wife after she dropped hers.  Very easy to set up.  Came with Windows 8.  That took a little getting used to.  She is happy... so you know what they say...

Reviews.Title: Great Computer For Games
Reviews.Author: Amanda Bales
Reviews.Content: I love this computer. It works great to play MMORPG's and for everyday entertainment. The graphics look great and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Computer, not a fan of Windows 8
Reviews.Author: Paul M Ambre
Reviews.Content: Only negative to this computer is and has been the Windows 8 OS.  However adding classic shell has increased the ease of use considerably since it now has a start button and menu.  Had to add 4GB RAM but that was inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: Great value. Works well except for the Win 8.
Reviews.Author: Roland Pokornyik
Reviews.Content: Great value. Had no real issues with it. Most problems are caused by Win 8.The laptop is fine, it would be nice if it would have higher screen resolution, but for this price it's OK.

Reviews.Title: Best Computer on a Budget
Reviews.Author: s benton
Reviews.Content: Outstanding computer for price, no load time when I turn it on, even when battery is dead. However, I hate Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop !
Reviews.Author: Not Knowledgeable enough
Reviews.Content: This is a very good laptop for money. I bought this laptop for my son who is in college and he is very happy with it, so far.He does his homework with it and plays all kind of games with it.

Reviews.Title: Good buy except for wireless issues
Reviews.Author: andrea
Reviews.Content: This review will note some of the details that I have noticed in the past few months of using this laptop. Most of my time on this computer has involved photo editing, web browsing, and word processing.-Something is terribly, terribly wrong with the wifi. Half the time it doesn't work. The other half of the time, I have to be within a three-foot diameter of the router. This is very frustrating because part of the reason I bought a laptop was for travelling.-All of my past computers have used an Intel processor, but I decided to take a risk with the AMD processor in this model. So far, so good in that respect.-Battery life could be better, but I knew that going in to this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great bargain
Reviews.Author: Gurdon Pendleton
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer a few months ago for school and it has done nothing but impress me. The processor speed is extremely fast for the price, the boot speed is impressive, and it doesn't get hot hardly at all. It does seem to have trouble with maintaining a connection to Wifi, but that is one of the only drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy On An ASUS Laptop Thru Amazon l
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: Great laptop & a fantastic buy. The money I saved on purchasing the laptop allowed me to buy several other items for it. I was in the market for a tablet, but the deal I got on this laptop made me completely forget about buying a tablet, lol !

Reviews.Title: Asus Laptop
Reviews.Author: chaukasu
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the purchase.  Started it up and kept going since then.  Still need to download office software.  Runs well other than that.

Reviews.Title: awesome laptop for the $$$
Reviews.Author: bill
Reviews.Content: faster than my old desktop even when it was new. buy this you wont be disappointed especially for the money

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Royce Holland
Reviews.Content: Seems like a good value, hope it lasts a long time. Price seemed right for the features included. Thank you

Reviews.Title: Was good for 2 weeks.
Reviews.Author: caitlin fowler
Reviews.Content: Hard drive problem, actually need to send it back to ASUS to have it fixed. Would turn on computer and see Aptio Home Utility and be stuck in it. Thank God for their year warranty. Other then that, I was really enjoying it for the first 2 weeks until I started having problems. Windows 8 is super easy. Cant wait to get my laptop back and hopefully have no more problems....

Reviews.Title: Amazing price to performance ratio
Reviews.Author: CCuneo1824
Reviews.Content: I have had this laptop for three months now, and FOR ITS PRICE it is the best computer I have ever used. I have friends with Mac Book Pros, Airs, Alienware, and I used to run Linux on my other laptops, but this one far outshines them all (most of them were twice the price too).Good - So yes I am raving about this, because for even double the price, you won't get any better performance. This is one of the best things I have ever bought in my life.Bad - You need to buy a mouse because the touch-pad literally SUCKS! This product couldn't be totally perfect, and everything has flaws, but seriously, this touch-pad is one of the worst I have ever used. BUT, DO NOT LET THAT DETER YOU FROM BUYING THIS LAPTOP!

Reviews.Title: Do Not Purchase This Laptop
Reviews.Author: John Reeder
Reviews.Content: The laptop screen remained black upon startup on the second time I used it. I could hear it running, but could not see anything. I finally read about other users having the same problem and resolved by removing the battery and holding down power button, which allowed startup. This isn't acceptable and I plan on returning the item.

Reviews.Title: Laptop did not work out of box
Reviews.Author: Thomas G
Reviews.Content: Order the laptop and it arrived on time. Opened the box all was good. tried to power up laptop and there was no hard drive activity. Laptop was dead. When I tried to exchange, the return site would not allow an exchange, only a refund. Refund was quick but when I tried to order the same laptop the price had gone up. Have not order a new/different one yet. (return arrived at return center the next day and I went on the site to order new one and price went up. Disappointed !!!!!!
