Reviews.Title: I love the specs, but this was my third and last Asus laptop.
Reviews.Author: Dennis Tsurkan "Dennis T."
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop the first time over the summer. Had scratches around the screen, returned it, got the same one the next day in the mail via overnight. Worked great! I absolutely loved gaming on it. Borderlands 2 ran on low-mid settings, Killing Floor on max, Far Cry 3 on low, etc. Games were playable. Then school started. I started bringing my laptop to classes, taking notes, and started that some of the keys weren't registering. Popped a couple off and the rubber portions weren't aligned evenly. Additionally, the trackpad was defective and didn't register my touch half the time.So a couple days ago I got tired of it, and called Amazon. With their great customer service they sent me out another one, which I'm typing the review on right now, and am deciding to return as well.Building a gaming rig, Asus was pretty great with the parts I used. But with this laptop, quality was hit or miss. The second time I got this Asus, it was whisper quiet and ran well, I returned it because of the keys not registering and also because my network adapter kept resetting while in school (taking notes in Google Docs while that happens kills).Got this third one a couple days ago and the fan is much louder. It runs slower, considering all I installed on it was Chrome thus far, and restarted a few times on its own.Essentially this laptop looks fantastic and is from a very reputable brand. It looks great, but feels very flimsy. The keyboard sinks in the middle quite noticeably.The GPU runs games on mid-settings just about, and the laptop stays cool. On my second Asus the fan was quiet, on this third one of the same model, it's loud, and is much slower. I'm done dealing with duds.I went and ordered a Lenovo G505s right before writing this for $50 more with a better processor and graphics card.For those of you who've had no issues with this model, good for you! Enjoy it, really. You're very lucky. Because I've had three of these and each one was a dud, so I went to Lenovo.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: Carlos Siu
Reviews.Content: It's a great laptop for my wife...but no so great for a gamer like me. Pros: Nice hardware, Cons: windows 8

Reviews.Title: Second Asus
Reviews.Author: Lane
Reviews.Content: This brand seems to have less problems than others we have had.  This is our second Asus.  We were pleased with the first one so didn't even research when we needed a second one.

Reviews.Title: 82 days old and DEAD
Reviews.Author: Kathryn M Sloane
Reviews.Content: Overall, a pretty ok machine. Until, it simply won't boot up. Asus is sending me an RMA, but I don't expect to have anything left on my hard drive when I get it back...and that's IF they fix it. We'll soon see!

Reviews.Title: Problem with Lap Top
Reviews.Author: Ralph Worden
Reviews.Content: Shortly after receiving my lap top I tried to load a program from my CD drive. It would not load. I thought at the time it was just an old out of date program. Today I discover that I have a corrupted driver. Being new to Windows 8 I find it very difficult to fix this problem.Of course I'm 6 days past being able to return the lap top.I sure hope I can find someone that can fix this with out costing me a small fortune.

Reviews.Title: No problems
Reviews.Author: Noel Dastugue
Reviews.Content: Not much to say , it does what I bought it to do..Windows 8 is not hard it's just different . I like windows 7 better

Reviews.Title: Designed okay, but rock solid
Reviews.Author: Akers
Reviews.Content: I generally like the product; there are a couple of design elements that I find funny. First, the mouse pad is large and sensitive enough that I frequently end up "clicking" with my palm when typing, which is really annoying. Second, it takes some getting used to to have the mouse buttons as part of the mouse pad, I frequently end up incorrectly clicking on things because there is no physical response in the fingertips to switching between the right click area and the left click area. Third the speakers are on the bottom, so the audio can be great on a table or other hard object. On the other hand, if you are using the computer on your lap or set it on a soft surface, such as a bed, the audio is not as great.I would give the computer five stars but for the mouse pad issues.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Jean
Reviews.Content: I really like my new computer.I tis fast ,great screen resolution.I would recommend this computer to anyone.easy to navigate q and good instruction

Reviews.Title: WOW!!!!!
Reviews.Author: happy hillbilly
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would fall inlove with a laptop, but thanks to this one, I have!! I just dont knoow what to say other than wow!

Reviews.Title: Incorrect advertisement of installed ram
Reviews.Author: Peacepg
Reviews.Content: Puter is fine but advertises that it ships with 6 gb memory but it came with only 4 installed ram. The touchpad is touchy. It has more pros than cons but the advertising is wrong re: the installed ram so don't be surprised. I bought it specifically because of the extra memory, so I was surprised and disappointed. Windows 8 is pretty groovy. I sure hope this turns out well.

Reviews.Title: review
Reviews.Author: joshua fraidenburg
Reviews.Content: Dislike windows 8 but there is a program to convert the format into windows 7 and take that garbage want to be cell phone look off of it.

Reviews.Title: its worth the money guys :P
Reviews.Author: Seyam Rahman
Reviews.Content: 750 gigs 6 gig ram !! with APU What else do you need :D and you can also run most of the games on medium and low settings :D ( i got it for 450 dollars)Only Con is : WINDOWS 8  D:I hate windows 8

Reviews.Title: Expected a lot more
Reviews.Author: Ghettojihad
Reviews.Content: Works as a bare-bones system if you want something for your ten-year-old to sort of learn computers with. Just don't expect much out of it. Comes infected with Windows 8 (aka Vista Junior), and wi-fi capability is poor. Web connectivity goes in and out all the time, to the point where dial-up seems to kick its butt. System gets bogged down by menial jobs, even with 6 GB of memory. Glad I got it for under $450, though still feeling a bit ripped off. Maybe I'll wipe all the crap off it, upgrade to Windows 7 & see if it can then handle such exceedingly demanding tasks as going to web pages and opening text files.

Reviews.Title: Asus computer is a piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Deborah Bargione
Reviews.Content: I would NEVER recommend an Asus! The motherboard lasted 18 months. What a rip-off! Who can afford to buy a new computer every 18 months.

Reviews.Title: Great Affordable Laptop for Gaming
Reviews.Author: Amber Patton
Reviews.Content: I really love my laptop!!! It is a very affordable laptop for gamers. The only issue I have had with it and I am not sure if it's just an issue with Win 8 or the system itself but it occasionally hangs while installing windows updates and that turns into a pain. Other than that, I haven't had any trouble with it. It runs and loads super fast and my graphic intense games run really well on it. I am VERY happy with this little laptop!!!

Reviews.Title: Item I received was defective; failed to turn on after 2 days of use
Reviews.Author: Evin P. Maguire "e-wing"
Reviews.Content: I understand that many people think ASUS is a great brand, and that very well may be. However, I have to give this particular product a 1 star rating. Here's why:It worked fine for a couple of days (despite taking almost 3 hours to download and install Windows 8.1), but on the morning of the 3rd day I had it, it failed to turn on. I left it plugged in and charging overnight, and still didn't turn on, or respond to the charger at all.I'm sure that the one I got was just defective, and had I got a properly built machine it would have worked fine, but this was not my experience.

Reviews.Title: WOW players, finally an affordable on the go gaming experience!
Reviews.Author: Kathleen A. Rivera
Reviews.Content: WOW fans, you can now take it on the go!  The graphics aren't supreme like the $1500 gaming laptops, but they are still excellent!  My son is so incredibly happy with this computer.  Yes, the Windows 8 makes it complicated, but all he needs is to click that WOW icon anyways.  There is occassional lag, but very few and far between.  I was amazed to get this type of gaming experience for this price!  Thank you ASUS!  I'm retained my super mom status once again!

Reviews.Title: I got it twice, and was twice disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Scotty
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm just the hard-luck kid, but I thought I should share my experiences with this machine.This seemed like a really good computer at a decent price.  When it came, it was a little big for my taste, but that's just personal preference.  The REAL problems began as soon as I started it up.No sound came from the speakers.  I returned it and had a replacement in a day or two.The trouble with the second one was that it would randomly go into a coma.  If left alone, the screen turned black, and pressing the power button did nothing but turn it to a lighter shade of black.  The problem soon worsened; every time I plugged in my USB mouse, the laptop...well, "died" really is the best word.  Complete and sudden shutdown, as responsive as a brick until I took out the battery, shook it around, and put it back in.  I had to do this every time.I gave up and got an Acer Ultrabook Silver.  It's smaller, cheaper, and doesn't randomly die.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: Janette Mathews
Reviews.Content: It's really made solid. Runs well. Really love it. It's my first one and I love it. Explorer 10 SUCKS.Had to pit 9 on. Windows 8 SUCKS TOO. Too put 7 if I can.

Reviews.Title: Reboot four times a day
Reviews.Author: Sauchum Ho
Reviews.Content: First wireless didn't work. Constantly asking for Window updates. Hung and reboot four times a day. Extremely poor product. Avoid it.

Reviews.Title: Inferior asus k55n db81
Reviews.Author: p.w. mac
Reviews.Content: This is not what I expected.  A friend has almost identical asus k55a ds51, purchased from the same store...  and she paid just 20 dollars more than I did and she purchasd hers months ago.  She gets 72 days stand by with 8gb.  This one gets 1 day stand by??  Very slow. Always dropping internet if not plugged in...  Every time I want to use it it reboots windows.  I have wasted so much time and lost so much work time that I do not want it. I gave it a chance and worked with it hoping the kinks would work out.  It is an inferior product.  I just submitted a request to ADORAMA CAMERA to return it.  I am that dissatisfied. I will give a follow up review of my return/exchange.  Hopefully ADORAMA CAMERA will resolve this for me expediently.

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Connor333
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 is horrid enough.  The track pad is useless.  I would simply drag my finger across the track pad, and for some reason it would pick up that there were two fingers expanding/collapsing.  For windows 8, this means if you are trying to move the cursor over something, it ends up expanding/minimizing.  I wanted to keep this computer - it is very powerful for the price.  Unfortunately, I had to return it.  Thank you amazon for understanding.

Reviews.Title: POS
Reviews.Author: Leslie Bradsher
Reviews.Content: It doesn't even deserve 1 start - its a pos.  It locks up constantly when having to update windows AND IT CONSTANTLY has to update.  Not a fan of the operating system - windows 8.  It sluggish and takes forever to respond to simple commands.  Perhaps I got a dud.  The worst part is you aren't dealing with the local merchant that you can return it too, when you buy from amazon its some back room merchant.  If you want to return it you get stuck with a restocking fee.  Or better yet, send back the laptop to have them FIX THE BRAND NEW LAPTOP????

Reviews.Title: Great Computer Nullified by Windows 8
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Rogers
Reviews.Content: Pure and simple - computer nice windows 8 no. It took me about five minutes to figure out "start" which is about the same time it took me to return it.

Reviews.Title: broke
Reviews.Author: Sindrome
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop and I was quite happy until it shut off and would not turn back on I've decided not to purchase another laptop or desktop I'll just use my kindle fire for the things I need

Reviews.Title: Hardware casing and mouse buttons.
Reviews.Author: Chad Simpson
Reviews.Content: The casing for the computer is cheaply made and the mouse buttons are sticky and part of the moue pad.

Reviews.Title: battery doesnt seem to be working
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: When I charge battery (its 2 days old) it still says unknown remaining when I go to see how much battery life is left after a charge

Reviews.Title: ASUS 15.6 LAPTOP and windows 8
Reviews.Author: Edward M Tucker
Reviews.Content: IF YOU ORDER ONE WITH WINDOWS 8... YOU WILLHATE IT... WINDOWS 8 IS NOT USER FRIENDLY NOR IS IT USER DESIREABLE...THE LAPTOP IS GREAT.. HAS ALL THE PROCESSING POWER AND ALL THE MEMORY YOU WOULD EVER NEED...  BUT WINDOWS 8 WILL NOT LET YOU USE IT YOUR WAY... AND IT CHANGES SCREENS WITH THE TOUCH OF YOUR MOUSE.. FRUSTRATING... I THINK MICROSOFT GOONED THIS ONE UP...  IT IS MY OPINION THAT WINDOWS 8 IS FOR TOUCH SCREENS, BUT THIS ONE IS NOT A TOUCH SCREEN... SO WHY PUT WINDOWS 8 ON IT?...  I THINK I'LL REVERT BACK TO WINDOWS 7.

Reviews.Title: Ohhh seller stop using fed ex
Reviews.Author: Awesome
Reviews.Content: Soooo the only reason I have not returned this computer yet is because i have not had time . Your delivery was not 1-3 days , also when I received the box it was extremely banged up, and you put packaging on the inside on one side and put the computer at the bottom of the box, and didn't note it as fragile. Sooo the computer has issues because of handling. It glitches horrible, it has shut down on me countless times and then randomly gives me an error that says cannot read USB device , Ive never plugged one in. Im pretty sure there are device issues inside this computer because of the way you packaged it. Whoever thought it was smart to send it the way they did needs to be smacked upside the head. Other then that I use the computer for light photo editing and playing world of warcraft which it plays pretty well when it is not glitching. OH also it states that it has ice cool and it might just be my computer but this thing over heats like crazy and I almost wonder if the fan isnt working. I know this laptop has potential and I have read many good reviews I think I just got one that was packaged poorly and got ruined in the process. So unfortunately I wont ever buy from this seller again.  Decent computer if I had got it not banged up.Thanks

Reviews.Title: JUNK!
Reviews.Author: Michael Alan Serviente
Reviews.Content: ASUS was recommended to me by some colleagues in our IT department, but I have found it to be junk. I have had a K55N mid-price range laptop for four months and the keyboard and screen have malfunctioned. I tried to return it for service which took three phone calls and chats, but was told it had been damaged, and ended up paying my own shipping and having it returned. I CANNOT find a replacement keyboard for it anywhere including ASUS!DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND NEVER BUY AN ASUS LAPTOP!

Reviews.Title: 6 gigs?
Reviews.Author: Brian Hatzelhoffer
Reviews.Content: why put a 4 gig ram card and a 2 gig ram card in? you are suppose to have two of the same for optimum performance. if i get this i will be making sure i get another ram card for it

Reviews.Title: bought two. both were defective. both were quickly returned
Reviews.Author: jay
Reviews.Content: bought two of these.windows 8 is the nightmare we've all heard it to be.but both machines were running very hot, fans on full speed, and of course batter life was terrible.so, we sent them back two days after arrival.

Reviews.Title: Windows 8 Sucks

Reviews.Content: Windows 8 is the worst attempt at an OS ever. Microsoft if you can't do better than this you shouldn't be in business.The laptop may be ok if I can get win 7 installed on it.
